newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada to set scope of Alliance Pipe assessment.
newsitem.headline: Canada to set scope of Alliance Pipe assessment.

text.p: Canada's National Energy Board said on Monday it was asking for comments on a draft environmental assessment to be used for the proposed Alliance natural gas pipeline project.
The NEB said the call for comments was in response to Alliance's preliminary submission covering the Canadian portion of the C$3.6-billion pipeline to Chicago from northeastern British Columbia.
The "draft scope" was developed in consultation with other Canadian federal departments and agencies, the NEB said.

Alliance Pipeline, planned by 18 energy companies including Alberta Energy Co Ltd, Gulf Canada Resources Ltd, Chevron Corp unit Chevron Canada Resources and IPL Energy Inc, would ship 1.3 billion cubic feet of gas per day along its route by 1999.
The consortium planned to apply to the NEB in mid-1997 for a certificate of public convenience and necessity to build and operate the Canadian part of the line.

The NEB said the scoping exercise was to provide a framework for Alliance's environmental assessment and involved a determination of the size of the project, factors to be assessed and the scope of the factors
The board said written comments were to be filed by May 16.
Alliance has already filed its application with the U.S. Federal Energy Regulatory Commission for the U.S. portion of the line.
